item.title: Directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 3672.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 164 (Roll no. 938). (text: CR H9812-9813)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 164 (Roll no. 938).(text: CR H9812-9813)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 239 - 179 (Roll no. 937). (consideration: CR H9820)
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H.Res. 500.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 500.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H9812-9821)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 101.

All points of order against the conference reoprt and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the conference report to its adoption without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate; and (2) one motion to recommit if applicable. Further provisions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-332, by Mr. Dreier.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-332, by Mr. Dreier.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2055) making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2012, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3672) making appropriations for disaster relief requirements for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2012, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 94) directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 3672.

Con. Res. 94) directing the Clerk of the House of Representatives to make corrections in the enrollment of H.R. 3672; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
